comment.text: This translation key is used to display "Your price" in a payment calculation context, typically on a settings page or pricing information section. It appears as a title and will be shown when certain conditions are met, indicating that the user's price should be displayed instead of another option.

usage.context:
fontWeight={600}
 noSelect
 className="payment_main-title"
 >
 {isGracePeriod || isNotPaidPeriod || isFreeAfterPaidPeriod
 ? t("YourPrice")
 : t("PriceCalculation")}
 </Text>
 {isGracePeriod || isNotPaidPeriod || isFreeAfterPaidPeriod ? (
 <CurrentUsersCountContainer
 isNeedPlusSign={isNeedPlusSign}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'Hintasi' is a possible translation, it's less common and potentially misleading. 'Hintasi' implies 'your suggestion' or 'your tip'. The accurate translation for 'Your price' in a payment context is typically 'Sinun hintasi' or 'Hintaasi'.

The Japanese translation "価格" (Kakaku) translates to "price" or "cost" in general, but "Your price" implies a personalized or specific price for the user.  A more accurate translation would convey this possessive element.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 検討価格 (Kentō Kakaku - Estimated Price) or あなたの価格 (Anata no Kakaku - Your Price)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "내 요금" (nae yogeum) is a possible translation for "Your price", it can also mean "My fee" or "My rate". "Your price" implies ownership by the customer, and a more accurate translation would be something that directly conveys that ownership.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 고객 가격 (gogaek gagyeok) - Customer price, or 당신의 가격 (dangsinui gagyeok) - Your price

ai_spell_check_issues.description: 'Your price' implies a personalized or specific price. 'Ücret' simply means 'fee' or 'charge' and lacks the nuance of 'your price'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Sizin Fiyatınız' (Your Price), 'Kişisel Fiyatınız' (Your Personalized Price), or 'Özel Fiyatınız' (Your Special Price), depending on the context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Phí thanh toán của bạn" is understandable, it's not the most natural or concise translation of "Your price." "Phí của bạn" or simply "Giá của bạn" would be more common and clearer in Vietnamese.
